answers.answer: Hey there! :)I have been on clomid for 3 months now and it did make me ovulate later.  Even though it was about 4 days later I kept thinking, "did I miss it?  Is it to late?".  So hang in there, it's probably a couple of days late.  Having said that as far as your dizzyness, nausea and things like that.  I had the same thing while taking clomid.  My nausea was the worst though.  I do think I gained about 8 lbs while taking it, definitely going to work on that now that AF has arrived.  I wouldn't chalk everything up to diabetes just yet, I'd look more into the clomid.  I was on 50 mg first time, then the last 2 times it was upped to 100 mg.  I cramped alot more, the nausea and headaches were worse.I completely understand the frustration. I've been trying for around 8 yrs now and I just figured when I first got married it would naturally happen.  It didn't!  Now all of my younger cousins are having babies. :(   I just wanna give up though.  I mean at least then I can go through the emotion of possibly never having a child and move on with my life. I won't be disappointed month after month when AF shows up.  BUT then think, IF I quit trying would I miss my chance?  Such a tough spot to be in.  I think "here I am 32 and I feel like I'm running out of time".  It's taken this long how much longer is it going to take??Anyways, just hang in there!  Praying the clomid works for you and you have a healthy little bundle of joy in no time! :)   Take care hun!!

I know I’m probably jumping to conclusions but, I never felt like this before; the dizziness and nausea while taking clomid. I don't know my mind runs wild when I feed it with wild accusations.Thanks for the kind words. Like I said before my sister-n-law has been trying to for years too. And look she is 12weeks. I find it ridicules that it has to take such a bloody long time for people like us to get pregnant. I really don’t want to have end up doing IVF or even IUI. If I got pregnant once even though it failed I’m sure I can do it again. I just hope it doesn’t take forever.Keep your head up high. It ***** watching younger family members getting pregnant before you. But, think of this use those babies to practice on. If they become screwed up for whatever you did at least it’s not your child. Lol.Good luck!!

lol Thanks!   You too hun, you're right it really does suck.  Like yourself I hope it doesn't take much longer, sheesh it's been long enough.  I also had a "chemical pregnancy" wayyy back in 2000.  Worse part was I wasn't even trying then and lost it before I even knew I had it. :(   I would probably do the IUI or IVF if I could afford it right now. My insurance pays NOTHING for infertility.  That ***** even more. :(  Oh well, I'm keeping my fingers crossed for the both of us!  Take care!  Lots of luck!! :D

question: Technically I am on my 4th round of Clomid. I say technically because I had a mc this past August. I wonder if anyone has ever ovulated late while on Clomid or are you regular? The last three doses I had I ovulated without fail on cd15. I started my AF on Jan. 12 and took 50mg of Clomid on cd3-7. So I should be having signs of ovulation and I am on cd16 (I know I’m prob. questioning to early but I’m curious on the question). My CM is wet but a little tacky; my temp is in 97.24, cervix firm/high. This past week I have been feeling light headed, nausea, my appetite is higher, sort of thirsty hungry too, and I’ve gained some weight. I have worked very hard and I still am working hard to lose the weight. I’m going to make an appointment with my Dr. but, I’m afraid he is going to say I have diabetes.At this point I am so frustrated with everything. I want to be a woman who can just get pregnant and have an easy healthy pregnancy. I’m probably more upset because I just found out my sister-n-law is 12 weeks pregnant.
title: Clomid and Ovulation
